emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Machine Learning
emerging_technologies.description: Utilization of quantum algorithms to enhance machine learning capabilities, allowing for solving complex problems exponentially faster.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize industries like pharmaceuticals, finance, and cybersecurity but also pose risks in terms of data security and privacy.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial costs, need for quantum education, and development of quantum-resistant cryptography.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuromorphic Hardware
emerging_technologies.description: Hardware that mimics the neural structure of the human brain to perform computation, enhancing efficiency in AI systems.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Might lead to more intuitive AI interactions, but also raises ethical questions about consciousness and AI rights.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Scalability, energy efficiency, and compatibility with existing systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Orbital Factories
emerging_technologies.description: Factories in space capable of self-repair, self-replication, and producing goods from space resources.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could reduce Earth's resource consumption and open new economic avenues but might also create new geopolitical tensions.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological reliability, economic viability, and international space law.

emerging_technologies.name: Carbon Negative Energy Systems
emerging_technologies.description: Energy systems that not only produce zero emissions but actively remove carbon from the atmosphere.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Significant step towards combating climate change, potentially leading to new industries and job markets.

emerging_technologies.name: Blockchain-based Digital Identity
emerging_technologies.description: Secure, decentralized systems for managing personal identity and data, reducing fraud and enhancing privacy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes privacy and could reduce identity theft, but challenges in universal adoption and integration with existing systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: User acceptance, regulatory framework, and interoperability with current services.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous vehicles integrated into the transportation system, reducing accidents and optimizing traffic flow.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in urban areas, with regulatory frameworks in place to manage safety and liability.

mainstream_technologies.name: Smart Grids
mainstream_technologies.description: Advanced electrical grids with AI and IoT integration for real-time energy management and distribution.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in developed countries, with developing nations catching up.

epoch_themes.description: The ethical considerations and governance of AI as it becomes more integrated into daily life.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shifts in employment, privacy concerns, and the need for new legal frameworks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing international collaboration on AI regulation and ethical standards.

epoch_themes.description: The expansion of human economic activities into space, focusing on resource extraction and manufacturing.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for new economic models, space law development, and environmental considerations.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise of private space companies, increased investment in space technology, and international space law agreements.
